clinical_study.brief_title: Smart Kneebrace for Continuous Monitoring of Joint Angles During Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: Smart Kneebrace for Continuous Monitoring of Joint Angles During Rehabilitation After Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the effect of Smart Kneebrace use for osteoarthritis patients after total knee arhtroplasty (TKA) on post-operative performance.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center, open-label randomized controlled clinical trail. A total of 60 participants will receive total knee arthroplasty, who will be randomly assigned into experiment or control group. Smart Kneebrace will be used for the patients during the rehabilitation for the patients in experiment group, while the patients in the control group will not receive such a smart kneebrace. Postoperative joint angles as well as visual analog scale pain score, the Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index knee society score will be estimated before operation and at 6/12 weeks after operation.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of postoperative joint angles
primary_outcome.time_frame: before operation and 6/12 weeks after operation
primary_outcome.description: Patients in both groups will wear the smart kneebrace by which the range of motion of the knee joint can be calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before operation and 6/12 weeks after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale of pain is a scale to extimate pain, and its score ranges from 0 to 10. The higher the score is, the more severe pain the patient is feeling.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before operation and 6/12 weeks after operation
secondary_outcome.description: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index(WOMAC),and its score ranges from 0 to 96. The higher the score is, the more severe symptoms the patient is feeling.

arm_group.description: Smart Kneebrace with a smart phone app will be used during the rehabilitation after surgery for three months
regular rehabilitation procedure will be applied after surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Smart Kneebrace with a smart phone app
intervention.description: Smart Kneebrace will be used during the rehabilitation. Patients wearing the Smart KneeBrace are able to know their daily activity summary and exercise performance during rehabilitation training through a smart phone app.
regular rehabilitation procedure, especially muscle strengthening exercises

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ready to receive single-side TKA
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindication of surgery
- self-reported diseases that cause lower limb disability (for example, cerebrovascular disease especially stroke)
